mods.abstract: Griffin talks about his life growing up in Thibodaux Louisiana, and his involvement in the civil rights movement in the late 1950s-1970s.
mods.note: This collection includes materials accessioned as Mss. 4700.2368; A digital version of the index (pdf) exists for duplication purposes; A digital version of the audio recording (mp3) exists for duplication purposes and public access in the Special Collections Reading Room; Interview conducted by Chadwick Griffin Jr.

Robert Griffin was born in New Orleans, Louisiana, and now lives in Thibodaux, Louisiana, where he's lived since he was a child. Griffin was very involved in the civil rights movement of the 1950s-1970s and participated in protests with Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.
